section.title:
inventory availability by planner code
planner codes inventory availability details for Inventory Availability by Planner Code
section.para: To view Inventory Availability by Planner Code, select the "Inventory Availability by Planner Code" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Inventory Availability by Planner Code, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Inventory Availability for all Planner Codes.
Specify Planner Code whose Inventory Availability you want to display.
Enter a Planner Code pattern to select a range of Planner Codes.Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in .
Show Availability using one of the following criteria:
Select to show projected Availability based on the Lead Time specified in the Item Site master.
Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 1000. Future Availability for the specified Item will be displayed based on the value entered here.
Display will show projected Inventory Availability as of date entered up to a maximum of 1000 days.
Display will show projected Inventory Availability for the date range entered.
Select to show Reorder Exceptions in display.
Select to ignore reorder at 0 in display.
Select to only show Inventory shortages in display.
Select to display Inventory Availability for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Inventory Availability you want to display.

Display lists Inventory Availability by Planner Code, using the specified parameters. If Planned Availability displays in the color orange, this means the actual or projected Quantity on Hand is at or below the Reorder Level. If the color is red, the current or projected Quantity on Hand is below 0.

note.para: When quantity appears in the "On Order" column, this refers to quantity that is on order through either a Work Order or Purchase Order. In the case of Purchase Orders, the quantity will always be represented in the Inventory Unit of Measure (UOM)--regardless of the Vendor UOM used on the Purchase Order.
